Finished reading The House on Mango Street and let me tell you @officialsandracisneros did a wonderful job with this book. The book is told from the point of view of Esperanzas a young girl and you definitely get the innocence a young girl would have. 
Itâ€™s also told in a series of short stories that allows for extra time to reflect in each situation. . One of my favorite stories was Alicia Who Sees Mice. A young lady left to care for her dad after her mother past who really wanted a better future but didnâ€™t have the support of her father.  #thehouseonmangostreet #thehouseonmangostreetbook #cafecito #coffee #agoodbookandcoffee #mexicanasthetics

Pender County Library is very excited to have been able to provide Heide Trask High School with several classroom sets of acclaimed author Sandra Cisnerosâ€™ book The House on Mango Street! These books were provided in partnership with UNCW's Office of the Arts and William Madison Randall Library, as a part of the NEA Big Read: Cape Fear program - a collaborative, year-long effort to promote literacy in Wilmington and the broader Cape Fear region. NEA Big Read is a program of the National Endowment for the Arts in partnership with Arts Midwest. 

Thank you to Monet Hardison, HTHS Librarian/Media Specialist, for helping to organize this and hosting a wonderful Books and Breakfast event!

#NEABigRead #NEABigReadCapeFear #thehouseonmangostreetbook #pendercountync #pendercountylibrary #uncw #RandallLibrary

What a well organized 6-weeks long book club meet at TRIO SSS In Truckee Meadows Community College 

The House on Mango Street by Sandra Cisneros is simply a marvelous miracle of growing up in the Spanish-speaking poor section of the Windy City. It's warm, uncluttered and sheer heartfelt humanity is a pure delight!

This book is a must read!

Event Executed by our Program Specialist @melody_hp 

Guest Speaker - Program Director @msjimenez6 

#tmccnevada #triosss #writerscommunity #reading #thehouseonmangostreetbook #communitycollege #tmccpaysoff #studentsupportservices #trioeducationalservices #triobookclub #firstgenerationcollegestudent#trioevents #nevadabookclub

After a small reading slump IM BACK! and I just finished The House on Mango Street. There is something so beautifully authentic about the book. The story follows Esperanza Cordero a young chicana girl growing up in the Chicago. 

I loved how the book was a series of vignettes. If you are a Latina like myself I definitely believe you should read this qt least once. It talks about community and following your dreams. I definitely recommend this book!

#bookstagram #bookinstagrammer #bookrecommendations #bookreview #books #chicana #thehouseonmangostreet #thehouseonmangostreetbook #Latina

â£
 Â© Orlando Almanza

The House on Mango Street is the remarkable story of Esperanza Cordero, a young Latina girl growing up in Chicago, inventing for herself who and what she will become. Told in a series of vignettes-sometimes heartbreaking, sometimes deeply joyous-Sandra Cisneros' masterpiece is a classic story of childhood and self-discovery. Few other books in our time have touched so many readers.

#thehouseonmangostreetbook #bookstagram #bookshelf #bookworm #thehouseonmangostreet

I transferred high schools in the middle of 9th grade. I ended up reading ANIMAL FARM twice and missed the chance to read THE HOUSE ON MANGO STREET. The House on Mango Street by Sandra Cisneros

ğ™¢ğ™® ğ™§ğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™£ğ™œ: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…

ğ™¢ğ™® ğ™©ğ™ğ™¤ğ™ªğ™œğ™ğ™©ğ™¨: I've read this book early this year but it quickly became one of my favourites of all time! I am now attached to it on an emotional and intimate level, and it is quite surprising. It came just at the right time: while reading it I felt understood, but it also opened my eyes to aspects of myself that I had not yet outlined, and of course educated me. I'm so so glad I read it!!
